Comments_List: I learned about how technology impacts the way we and our society handle sensitive information. In particular, I became very aware of the state of my own data privacy and why I should care.
How we can better protect our data privacy in the world today

This course is engaging because it is a seminar with capped enrollment - everyone in the course was there because they wanted to be there. Much of the course is taught by students, so there is variability in the quality of individual lectures, but overall, the material and discussions were interesting and relevant.
Strength: Prof. Fischer is awesome, willing to provide help to us.
I enjoyed the discussion-based class. Student presentations as a foundation for discussion were very interesting. Freedom to research and write about anything you want to.

I would recommend this course to all computer science majors. I found that this course changed the way I think about technology and has influenced how I act on the Internet and in my software engineering processes. I suspect students will consider this course a gut since it's a computer science course with no coding, and that alone is a major problem. I am shocked that we don't require students to learn about the ethical implications of their computer science endeavors.
Yes. Awesome CS course, critical thinking all the time.
Highly recommend, especially with recent events involving data privacy -- more people should be aware
